author: Special Correspondent
text:
Indicating that the polls to elect 234 legislators to the 15th Tamil Nadu Legislative Assembly are just few months away, electronic voting machines (EVMs) from various parts of the country have started to arrive in various districts of the State during the last few days.

In the first batch, as many as 2,762 units (balloting unit and control unit) from Pune arrived in Salem on Friday and another 950 arrived at The Nilgiris from Kolhapur district of Maharashtra.

“As of now, a total of 3,712 units have arrived in Salem and The Nilgiris. By the end of this month, we expect to get the full lot of 75,000 units. As for Chennai, the EVMs would arrive in the last week of this month,” Chief Electoral Officer Rajesh Lakhoni said. Training schedule of the officials to be involved in the electoral process is expected to pick up after the release of the final electoral rolls for all the Assembly constituencies on January 20.

Voters with complaints in their Elector’s Photo Identity Cards card or the electoral rolls can call 1950 .

Efforts are on to enable 1950 receive messages from voters. The Election Commission is also taking efforts to increase the size of the call desk from 10 to 30.
title: EVMs start arriving
